description.narrative:
The Program is expected to have the following development impact:
-- Project outcomes:
- Stakeholder impact: The Program will provide: (i) Financing to selected developers, via banks, to enable more sustainable growth and quality of the affordable housing sector; and (ii) Mortgage financing for homebuyers, targeting borrowers in underserved income ranges.
- Economy-wide effects: indirect and induced effects during and after construction (estimate of overall contribution to job creation and increase in economic activity post-appraisal).
- Environmental effects: Developers and banks will be encouraged to use IFC's Green certification tool - EDGE - for environment friendly construction and GHG reduction.
-- Contributions to market creation:
- Competitiveness: by supporting developers who have historically focused on high-income families to go down market to the lower income segment.
- Sustainability: by setting market standards through the proposed certification tools

The proposed investment is a program of up to US$100 million equivalent to support the construction and commercialization of affordable houses in Côte dIvoire. The Program will provide funding to banks for on-lending to selected housing developers and homebuyers and will be executed in two phases. For Phase 1, IFC has identified two participating banks, namely Banque Atlantique Côte dIvoire (BACI) and Société Ivoirienne de Banque (SIB), with a total financing package of US$60 million.
